website_summaries.verdict: An incredible value if you have mild to medium snow blowing jobs to accomplish and don't want to go over your budget.
pros: With reliable 13A of power, lightweight build, and easy-to-maneuver wheels, it effectively moves snow without a high price tag
cons: Owners gripe about flimsy feel of the plastic components
Dense, wet snow can be challenging for it to move

customer_reviews.title: Did a Superb Job on an 11" Early Morning Surprise
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a few years back when we moved to the Denver, CO, area. We only used it a few times. It did well enough. But the real test came recently (Jan 2017) when we cleared 8" that hit one day, and then another 11" hit overnight. Yikes. Although the snow was sometimes tighter than the machine itself, it did a dutiful job of clearing our sidewalks, drive and front area, as well as the same for the neighbor. I am very happy with this machine. It is not a heavy duty machine, and we knew that when we bought it. However, it did a superb job on our 11" morning surprise!
customer_reviews.author: Mindgrowz

customer_reviews.title: Buy... You won't be disappinted.
customer_reviews.text: Sure, a gas version means you don't have to drag a cord... BUT... corroborators clog, engines have issues starting in the cold... batteries need replacement. It throws the snow as promised. I used it to cut through snow that was 6 inches think. Was a breeze! Oh, and it stores nicely... after snow season... it collapses down and is stored on a shelf out of the way. Can't do that with a gas blower either!
customer_reviews.author: mama lion

customer_reviews.title: Just finished clearing my driveway from great blizzard of 2016 (33" + inches of snow) with ...
customer_reviews.text: Just finished clearing my driveway from great blizzard of 2016 (33" + inches of snow) with Snow Joe. Can't say enough for the little guy. Great machine even when the snow depth exceeds advertised amount. I'd be snowed in until July without Joe.
customer_reviews.author: JHM

customer_reviews.title: Different problems than a gas blower, but for some like me an easier choice
customer_reviews.text: Great electric blower if you have a relatively straight path to clear. Becomes cumbersome when working around and between cars as the cord gets in the way. Quiet and odor-free when compared to a gas model, and easier to maneuver. Hangs out of the way on my wall and sweeps my walks clean of powdery snow
customer_reviews.author: R. Slegel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great
customer_reviews.text: Okay..This is a good deal. It is harder to snow blow with a cord dragging behind you however once you get used to that it's great. And hey in the middle of a snow storm you don't have to run to the store to get gas. I live in Detroit Michigan, and this thing works great. I dig that it's so inexpensive and has a 2 year warranty. So far, I love it
customer_reviews.author: Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Our HOA shovels our driveway whenever it accumulates over 2". I bought the SJ620 to do clean-up on the inch or two that accumulates AFTER the HOA has done their job, and it's perfect for that task. Single-stage snow blowers are not good solutions for wet or slushy snow, but this is great for light, powdery stuff. Saves my broken back.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Wiig

customer_reviews.title: About What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Pushing it through snow isn't a cakewalk, but it does make the job of moving snow slightly easier. Here's an interesting problem I noticed that only slightly bothered me. The handle you crank to direct the direction the snow is thrown needs to be turned slightly past the bottom most point in its rotation to get all the way to one side. So pushing it and gravity cause the handle to fall back down, and directing the snow slightly more towards center. I found myself having to keep turning it to keep it pointed where I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: good for clearing small amounts of snow.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job cleaning up. I mainly got it for when i push snow off the driveway and with a shovel the snow would always push off the sides of the shovel and I would end up doing the same spot multiple times. This does a good job of throwing the snow a few feet so once i clear a line I don't just push more snow into the cleared area again. It's nice just plugging the machine in and going without worrying about gas/fumes. Doesn't work great for dense or high snow and when the plow block the driveway in you are better off using a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: EmanHavi

customer_reviews.title: Snow joe got the job done. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: We got about 6 inches of powdery snow. I have a large driveway about 40 ft x 50 ft, sidewalk, RV pad and backyard area for the dogs. The snow joe cleared it all in about an hour. It never got plugged up. The only slight downside is having to mess with cord and the chute would sometimes move a bit if the control handle was up and gravity pulled it down. But other than that it was all thumbs up. Would definitely recommend. It even chewed through the 10 inch pile left by the snow plow at the end of the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Its all about the user expectation level and it would not be a replacement for a good gas-powered snowblower
customer_reviews.text: This is the second season with this snow blower/broom. If your expectation is to shovel less, this should work well. We just had about 13~14inches of snow with snow drifts measuring more. It performed quite well, especially for fluffy snow. One needs to take it slow for deep snow obviously. Our unit has taken some beating and there must be a plastic piece ever so slightly misaligned because there is a little more rattles this season than the first year. But with all things considered it let's us shovel less. Its all about the user expectation level and it would not be a replacement for a good gas-powered snowblower.
customer_reviews.author: Mashi

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.  Just wish the cord would not get in the way when you use it...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give 4.5 stars. The Snow Joe is great, but that electric cord just gets in your way that you have to be aware of it being there or you will run it over (like I did) and have to repair or replace the cord. come up with some sort of item to wrap/unwrap cord as you use the blower and you will be fine. It does a great job. No knocks against the snow blower. It does a nice job!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Snow Blower
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great workhorse for an electric snowblower. Probably best up to about 7 inches of snow. I would personally purchase the 22 inch wide as it is exactly the same except you can do wider and probably up to about 10-12 inch of snow. Extremely easy to use. This is really great as you never have problems starting. Yes, you do have to bother with a cord whereas you do not with the gas blowers. But all aside this snow blower worked great for me this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Shoulda got a good one
customer_reviews.text: Ok. When shoveling is easier than using a snow blower, you have a problem. This thing struggled with six inches of snow. Heaven forbid it a wet snow. Literally wouldn't work then. It threw the snow like 2-4 feet at most when pointed sideways. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: gar 3

customer_reviews.title: Very capable little electric snow blower
customer_reviews.text: I have to say all things considered my little snow blower purchase was worth it. This is the second time I have used this and today it cleared our driveway (20'x50') in about an hour after about 4" of snow and a crust of ice on top. Throws the snow farther than I thought it would, probably about 15-20'. It even handled the slushy stuff in the street left from the plow trucks relatively well. It's certainly no gas blower, but does a really good job. This blower works better when there is more than about an inch of snow, when you have too little it barely throws it, although that's how most are too.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Fitterling

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime I spent
customer_reviews.text: Good small snow blower, I got it when it was a lightning deal for $125 so worth every cent. I have used it for a few inches of snow and I used it when we got 3ft for snow this year. It worked very well just had to chip the snow pile down to a manageable height. Totally saved my back on that day. The only down fall is that the adjustments for the shoot are limited but it does throw the snow a fair distance. Would recommend it for someone that doesn't need a big bulky snow blower.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: The. Best.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this little trooper for six hard Minnesota winters now and it's never even hiccuped. We're on a corner and so have a LOT of snow blowing to do and even in the heaviest snow, this machine pushes right through. Like even on the post-plow-end-of-the-driveway snow. It also starts every time with the push of a button and is light enough for me to carry up stairs.
customer_reviews.author: luckypenny

customer_reviews.title: This thing worked like magic in the blizzard of 2016 at 20 inches ...
customer_reviews.text: Wished I had bought it 10 years ago which would have saved me the pains of a hernia surgery in October that I believed came from 30 years of shoveling snow . This thing worked like magic in the blizzard of 2016 at 20 inches of snow. I had to ram it back and forth to the snow piles on my 50 feet driveway to clear the snow. My two arms hurt afterwards but no bending and heavy lifting. Incidentally I bought a gas snow thrower after the record snowfalls in 1996 that got clogged up in oil/gas mix and never used once because no snow the following year. Electric means no oil/gas mix to clog up the machine. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Evans L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother. Junk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after rotator cuff surgery knowing I probably couldn't shovel snow this year. First snow today, about 3" of light snow. This damn thing would barely throw the snow out of its own way. Then after about 5 minutes started smelling like hot wire and quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gomez

customer_reviews.title: but worked just fine thru areas that were up to 14" deep
customer_reviews.text: Just got 12 inches of snow here in Denver. This thing sliced right through it and threw it quite far. It's only rated for 10" deep, but worked just fine thru areas that were up to 14" deep. The snow was moderately heavy. (not just powder) Will wait to see how it does with heavy snow.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use, my dog could use it!
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this as an open box special through Amazon Warehouse Deals. I finally got to use it for the first time and it worked pretty good. I will say I followed the advice of others and sprayed PAM inside the shoot before using. The hardest thing about using this is the extension cord. But that's just the way it is. The only gripe I have is that the shoot will start to slowly turn from vibration. I'm not sure how I'll remedy that situation just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Marinara

customer_reviews.title: We are having the worst winter in Maine and Snow Joe is blasting through ...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this little guy. We are having the worst winter in Maine and Snow Joe is blasting through foot high snow. See my video This has got to be the 7th time this season Joe annihilated foots of snow from our property. Not only does he hammer the snow from the porch, Joe clears paths all around the house. Big help with the driveway too. Joe is amazing! The only negative comment could be the electrical 100ft extension cord management but it is so worth working through that minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: dhark

customer_reviews.title: No more snow drifts
customer_reviews.text: Love this little electric snowblower. I used to have a gas powered one but after each year it would always have trouble getting started. This electric one starts right up and can clear snow rather quickly. The only draw back is that it works best with two people so you have someone to keep track of the extension cord as you clear the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Walter G. Merriam IV

customer_reviews.title: This thing works amazing for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This thing works amazing for what it is, an electric snow blower. We had 10 inches sitting on the driveways when I got this. Opened up the box, 3 minutes later it was assembled. Sprayed the chute and blades with some wd-40 and went to it. This little thing can really move some snow, even the hard stuff at the end of the drive (for that it took two passes, but it still got it) the cord dragging behind you is kind of a pain but it's sure a lot better than having to mess with keeping gas and oil on hand and getting all exhaust fume smelly before work. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thompson

customer_reviews.title: OK so far
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'2", so the handle is a little low, but this seems to be a common problem with any garden tool I use (mower, etc) The blower handles light snow well and has cleared a 8" fall we had recently pretty well. It even handled the mess the snowplow leaves at the end of the driveway (#^$^&$*%^^#$#). I just wish that it had a little more weight to it, so it would stay down on the pavement and not tend to float up ON the snow. You must also be constantly aware of your extension cord, but I've gotten used to that with other tools I use in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jay A Hafner

customer_reviews.title: Works well for this Minneapolis resident.
customer_reviews.text: Works well on all the snow we received in Minneapolis during winter 2017-2018. For some heavier snowfalls, I took half-width cuts or knocked high banks down with a shovel, but it made short work of clearing my city driveway and walk. I really should have bought one of these years ago when we were out in Waconia with the big suburban driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Larson

customer_reviews.title: Very useful to have.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I have been sharing my Snow Joe for the last two very snowy years in NY (she lives across the street). I decided to buy her one as a present so we don't have to share the valuable limited time we have to clear the snow. This is a great snow blower. Best for 4-10 inches of snow, but after a blizzard, it is still better than shoveling huge mounds without it. When those street plows come around and push the packed snow back across your driveway, a snowblower is crucial, and this machine is up to the task. So now we have a second Snow Joe on the block.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Good snow blower for small areas.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a couple of times now to clean our driveway at our vacation home. A bit awkward keeping electric cord untangled, but the blower works reasonably well. Easier than shoveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works but feels like a child's toy
customer_reviews.text: The overall construction feels flimsy. It is so lightweight that it doesn't plow down to the ground without muscling it. The wheels often come up off the ground because of this which makes it harder to push. I'd rather have one with drive assist, which would also help with turning this. Turning into snow is near impossible because of it's lightness.
customer_reviews.author: P. D. Perrault

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Had the first heavy snow with ten inches and used the Snow Joe for the first time. EXCELLENT! It handled the ten inches with no problem, and I was able to clear a large driveway and side walk in twenty minutes. This does everything it says it does, and I cannot imagine going back to hand shoveling ever again. A++
customer_reviews.author: Pelham

customer_reviews.title: Great for light duty but uneven quality.
customer_reviews.text: Our first Snow Joe died in a a few passes at 4 inches of snow. There was a pop and smoke or steam. That was the end. Seriously, it took me longer to get suited up for snowblowing than it lasted. We returned it for another. Snow Joe The second arrived and we quickly put it to work. No problems at all. It worked great. We bought it for our deck but we had some light snow so we used it on the driveway too. No problem handing the job. The nice thing is you don't smell like gasoline after using it. Great for light duty.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a couple design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Timely delivery. Works great under 5 inches of snow. So don't wait before doing a pass. However I agree with other reviews that a) keeping an eye on the electric cord is a two person's job (got mine sucked into the snow blower first time around) and b) it is a pain to keep a hand on the trigger and one should use a clamp. Hence the four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Cottin

customer_reviews.title: Other than that its very light weight and seems like it will be easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The lever to move the directional shoot doesn't work at all and there is no way to access where it actually connects, so unable to try and fix it. Unfortunately, I didn't put it together within the window to send it back because we haven't had a lot of snow YET. So, I'm stuck with it! I will have to manually move it when needed, which is going to be a pain because its kind of hard to move. Other than that its very light weight and seems like it will be easy to use. Have not had enough snow to try it out yet. I'll review again once I've actually used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this snowblower is useless. Instead of picking it up and blowing it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric snowblower in early November, to use on my deck here in Northern Vermont. Although it does seem to work OK if the snow is very light and powdery, if the snow is heavy and wet (the very conditions in which a snowblower is most useful), this snowblower is useless. Instead of picking it up and blowing it out the chute, it merely pushes snow; NO snow gets picked up and blown anywhere. The Toro blower, although its rotor is plastic, does a much better job. Avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Engels

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for what it is: low cost, electric, self-propelled
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Can't use in deep snow but for the occasional few inches it's a lot better than shoveling. Dealing with a cord can be a pain but that comes along with not having a battery or gas power. It can be a little tiring to push, especially in deeper snow, so if you're in poorer health I would recommend something with a drive-assist type system so you don't need to manually provide the force to push it along. But again, it's a great deal for the cost and as long as you know what you're looking for in a snowblower, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Snow far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far this season I've only gotten to use this once. It's been an abnormally dry winter in Northern Arizona. The first (and only) time I used it I inadvertently picked up a loose chunk of asphalt from the drive. It clattered around inside for a second before I shut it down & unfortunately it broke off some of the plastic. It didn't appear to affect how it functioned though - it slogged through about 6 inches of medium wet snow like nothing & the cinders & gravel on the drive weren't a problem either. Just be careful where you aim it if you have a gravel base! It certainly does shoot the snow out!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.
customer_reviews.text: At around $150 the unit represents good value. There are some notable drawbacks to electric models that should be expected: 1) Cords are a pain. I have a 30ft driveway. So just flipping the cord around so I don't run over it is annoying, but something you know going into it. Just worth restating, but it's smaller than most gas-powered throwers and doesn't have the price or maintenance annoyances, so for me, a worthwhile trade. 2) Used it for 4 or so snowfalls this year. It's not a bad little guy. Seems to like the heavier snow versus the powder. I never let it build beyond 5" so I couldn't say how it handles more than that.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this item
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this item. Works better than I expected, light enough to carry without trouble, can be safely stored indoors during the off season. I read the other reviews and lock-tited the appropriate fasteners before use, and they are all still here. Dealing with the cord is a major challenge, but that's the nature of any corded device. Once I figured out how to run the cord so it would stay out of my way it bacame a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jackmin

customer_reviews.title: Okay for light to medium snow fall
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very light and easy to store up in the rafters or on a hook. A little assemble needed but no more than 5 minutes. Cons: In the pictures it looks quite large but check that it is 18" and is just that. As it's very light don't expect it to deal with great with snow higher than 8" with one go. The start switch is a little awkward but I guess if you have kids you don't want them turning it on too easy. I found pushing it with the handle higher made it get lowed to the ground to compensate for the light weight and not ride over the top of the snow.
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical - living in Upstate NY, you get accustomed to snowblowers that konk out on you at the most inopportune moments. However, this guy has lived up to the hype. Once you get used to the cord - it's similar to holding a cord while vacuuming - you're all set. Pushes through a good 8 inches of relatively heavy snow - even the stuff the plow dumps at the end of the driveway - with relative ease. Just remember, this isn't a behemoth gas blower - so, if you're getting a blizzard, don't wait til all of the snow has fallen. Take this out in stages -- every 4-6 inches at a time. Still beats shoveling!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: And it was kind of fun using it
customer_reviews.text: We only had one mild snow storm this winter of about 3" so I haven't been able to give this a real test. But it worked extremely well in clearing my driveway. And it was kind of fun using it! It! For an electric powered machine, however, it was louder than I expected. Probably as loud as a gas one.
customer_reviews.author: jenjan

customer_reviews.title: Good for older folks with cardiovascular issues.
customer_reviews.text: I am almost 59 and after my stroke last summer, shoveling snow is too difficult. This thing moves everything from light, fluffy stuff to the snowbanks thrown up by the alley plow. Doesn't manage to cut through old, packed snowbanks but for something light enough to be below the weight limit imposed by my doctor, it's alright. Easy to push unless you want try going through more than 10 inch deep snow. I would recommend using as short a cord possible - a 100ft, 12 gauge cord is twice the tangle factor and 3 times the weight of a 50ft, 14 gauge cord.
customer_reviews.author: Mediocrates

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with 3" or so of snow
customer_reviews.text: Pretty junky. I live in IN and with just a few inches of snow, this wouldn't move.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCakes

customer_reviews.title: Performed well
customer_reviews.text: I'm 65, with arthritis, bursitis, tendonitis, and two neck fusions, I am NOT shoveling snow any more. It handled our last 8" snow just fine.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: It's not a heavy duty self propelled blower but with just a little elbow grease it clears up to 8 inches of snow easily. You will still have to do a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Snowblower for over 4 years and for the price it does exactly what you want it to do.It's not a heavy duty self propelled blower but with just a little elbow grease it clears up to 8 inches of snow easily.You will still have to do a little shoveling at the end of your driveway for the real heavy street plow mounds but this machine will save you a lot of time and energy.I use a 100 ft. extension cord and working around the cord is a very minor problem.For the price and the freedom of almost no maintenance its a real trooper.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow thrower - ever for wet snow!
customer_reviews.text: Two days after delivery, we got about 4" of very wet snow. I had not yet opened the box, so I started to shovel by hand, since I had not assembled it yet. SURPRISE - I decided to check the box. NO ASSEMBLY REQUIRED!!! Just take it out of the box, raise the handles and tighten four knobs to hold handle and insert chute bar. TWO MINUTES !!!!! I proceeded to shovel about a 100' driveway of 4+" WET snow with little effort. This thrower launched the snow at least 12-15' - pretty good for heavy wet snow. It never clogged!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Backsaver!
customer_reviews.text: Was up and running 15 minutes after getting it out of the box. Works great, there are no wheels on the front as is the case with most snow throwers. Very light weight and easy to maneuver. Watch for heavy snow (mix of snow and slush) the chute will become plugged and you have to stop and clear it. Takes very little to clear and keep going. The deflector is directional (up and down) but don't expect to make it a 90 degree angle. Easy to change direction of the throwing chute. Having as much fun as one can have throwing snow!
customer_reviews.author: mpkramer

customer_reviews.title: Great little snowblower!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this snowblower for two winters now and it has more than paid for itself- it's great! We have had several deep snows (5-8 inches) and it goes right thru. I only have two negative things to say about this blower and they are minor. The first is the holder to keep the electric cord from coming unplugged is very narrow and my larger outdoor cords don't fit well so I just tie the cord around the handle then plug it in. The second is the handle to turn the snow chute is loose so it vibrates and moves. To fix that I just wrap a couple zip ties around it.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne mccain

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a good unit if it ran
customer_reviews.text: This Snow Joe arrived as ordered. It seemed to be a useful unit for light to medium snow fall. However, it developed a short of some kind within 5 minutes of use and started blowing out 20 amp circuit breakers. I used a 100 ft 12 ga chord. Tried different circuits and they all blew out. I contacted Amazon and they were great. They quickly responded with return information. I had to get a refund because they were out of stock with similar Snow Joe's. The only other issue had with the unit was the clutch handle seemed flimsy. Otherwise, if it worked, it seemed like it would do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Sharbonno

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my parents who are in their late 50s and it was the best gift ever for them, my father cannot thank me enough for the purchase. Says it performs great and so easy to take care of because no oiling or cleaning. In addition to this purchase, I got them a 100 ft outdoor plug so ey have plenty of length to do driveway and walkway. This machine has been put to the test 4 times in the last 3 weeks including 8 inches and slush and handled beautifully. Unless you have a lot of property and you don't mind being plugged in, use this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Momoftwo

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: This worked better than expected. Some of the reviews were iffy but we just used easily during a decent sized snow storm and this easily removes 6 inches of snow. If you are dealing with 12-15 it may be tough but if you use this before it gets ridiculously deep it is perfect -- and much easier than all that shoveling!
customer_reviews.author: higgs

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is and what they said it would be
customer_reviews.text: I have a large, self-propelled snow thrower. It is inconvenient for small jobs and too unwieldy for my wife to use. She loves to get out during a snowfall and clear the drive and the walks. This did the trick. Easy to manipulate and direct and very efficient in 2-3 inches of heavy snow or 4-6 inches of the light fluffy stuff. Good safety switch. Obviously, the big downside is the cord which was not a big deal for me given the configuration of my driveway. Plan, however, on adding a $30-50 expense for a heavy duty grounded cord. Bottom line, it does what it says and at $109, it was well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Little Buoy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Ooh yes, love love love it. When snow hit here in NYC, other salted, shoveled, and I did it in minutes with this snow thrower. Wired is a pain in the behind, but at least I am not smelling the fumes, or dealing with oil headache. I will buy another one for my other home.
customer_reviews.author: NYQ83

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but can't beat gasoline
customer_reviews.text: This snow thrower is excellent if you do not have square miles or hectares to do. It works very well, but its limitation were almost achieved on this last snow storm we went through in Chicago early January. It was almost too much for the Snow Joe but with pushing and perseverance then I was able to make it through. I would still recommend a gasoline type especially that it is a drag to roll out/in the electrical cord and also this item is on the sub par to almost average compared to average gasoline snow thrower. I am pretty happy though...
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H

customer_reviews.title: It's better than a shovel
customer_reviews.text: It's better than using a shovel but I have a couple of issues with it. -Doesn't work well with wet snow -Doesn't blow the snow far enough in my opinion so when it's windy, the snow blows right back on me -The long electrical cord is a bother for me. I yanked my cord back trying to get it out of the way and it got caught and wrapped around the blades. It was hard trying to pull that cord out of the blades I decided to purchase a Gas Blower after all.
customer_reviews.author: MoneySpender

customer_reviews.title: Works great, doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: When using this thrower to clear out the driveway it worked very well. I used it for 1 1⁄2 winters in a Chicago suburb. About half way through the 2nd winter I started to smell something like burning electronics. About 2 minutes later the thrower started pumping out grey smoke. No fire, but it ended up dying right there. If it had lasted longer it would have been used every season. It did a great job clearing the snow. But the short life made me have to spend more money for another thrower.
customer_reviews.author: d0gg

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lightweight snowblower to clean off our small amount of sidewalk. Being over 70, I really don't like to get out and shovel any more. This the perfect answer. It's lightweight, electric(no struggling to start it) small (OK I have to do 3 passes instead of 2) and even handles well packed snow. Clean off the sidewalk, put it back in the garage and wait till next time, couldn't be better or easier. I would heartily recommend it..Probably won't do driveways or long stretches of sidewalk very easily, but it works for me
customer_reviews.author: Doberman7

customer_reviews.title: Two Snows in Boston
customer_reviews.text: I relied on the reports from Connecticut users regarding how it worked in Nemo to decide to buy this. There have been two snows here in Boston since I received the Snow Joe. It has worked well both times. Today's snow was 8 inches of especially wet, heavy stuff. The only thing I could wish for would be bigger wheels! It doesn't throw the snow very far, but far enough. And it even cleared the denser stuff that the snow plows threw up onto my sidewalk (usually after I've shoveled), although I'm not going to try clearing the end of the driveway with it. So I'm satisfied with it. Now for an electric cord caddy!
customer_reviews.author: kvetch

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just finally got to use this little charm yesterday. I had purchased it in September and it has been waiting patiently for it to snow. I was done so fast with snow removal with this snow blower. I was able to do all of my driveway, sidewalks, and passage ways with ease. I love the lightweight maneuverability and the way it even handled the crap at the end of the driveway from the plows. I love how I can lift it up and put it away easily in my garage. I recommend this for anyone who needs something easy to move around that works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Worden

customer_reviews.title: Better than trying to start a gas engine
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in 4 inches of heavy snow. That was the only time I used it. Much better than trying to start a gas engine in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a long time, but this thing is no good for wet snow. We got a lot of wet snow recently and I had to go buy a gasoline powered snow blower because the wet snow almost burned up the motor, I could smell the subtle burning so I stopped using it before it became too damaged. It still works fine with no smell on fluffy snow. But since I have a gasoline snow blower now, Im going to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine! Easy to use and throws snow really well. Spray the inside of the chute with some WD40 to prevent snow from sticking. Update: snow blower is dead. Sparks and the smell of melting plastic from the housing. This thing is supposed to throw a lot of snow, but it will not throw wet snow. The snow the plow pushes up on the sidewalk, for example. It strains and grinds and bangs around. It will not move this snow. We're out $160. Save your money or spend a little more and get a good gas snow blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jmmercer

customer_reviews.title: Saves time, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got my 2nd snow and finally was able to use it. The 1st snow wasn't much. This thing shaved off so much time for a woman of 60 yrs. It took me 40 minutes to do my driveway and walkway. Both would take me approx. 4 hours with a shovel. I am glad i made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Rated for up to six inches of snow. With ...
customer_reviews.text: Rated for up to six inches of snow. With a 50 x 10 foot area it has proven functional without purchasing more equipment than needed. The hand crank to direct the throwing direction is a welcome safety feature to avoid any reason to be in harms way. Unit is light enough to lift and carry if needed and the folding handle frees up space when stored.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Logan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Have driveway plowed, but use this for clearing paths in rear of house for people and our puppy who is not that tall right now. Also use it to clear rear deck. Former Gasoline powered snow thrower user. First time electric snow thrower user. No hassles with gasoline or starting!!. Was very impressed with its power. Took only one time to get the hang of manipulating the electric cord. Bought 12/3 Premium Quality 100' extension cord and full power was delivered. Did not even break a sweat clearing big deck and paths behind the house.
customer_reviews.author: kasdesign

customer_reviews.title: Good for the heart.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with snowfall up to 8 inches, but only up to about 4 inches if it's very heavy and wet, and somewhat more if it's light and dry snow. Similar to using a leaf mulcher, it does require a bit of planning and may require multiple sessions during a significant snowfall. That said, it's easy to use and far, far easier than shoveling. My cardiologist wholly approves of its use.
customer_reviews.author: Huffy49

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Great for us seniors
customer_reviews.text: I have had gas powered snow blowers. They always needed maintenance. I spent 10 minutes setting the Snow Joe up. I sprayed lube where the manual said. I sprayed Pam in the shoot. Yesterday we received 6 inches of snow. In 30 minutes, I cleared a 20x60 driveway. I never forced it. It never sounded like it was straining. With what they charge for shoveling snow and the wait for them to come. One or two more snows and the Snow Joe will have paid for it's self. 37.5 lbs makes it easy to handle and store.
customer_reviews.author: kab

customer_reviews.title: can't handle the heavy stuff
customer_reviews.text: bougth this unit one year ago and used it 8 times before it literally started smoking and died mid way through clearing my driveway. While it worked was more than adequate to clear my large driveway and walkway. The power cord was a nuisance and got run over quite a few times and had to be cleared out of the sweeping mechanism. Works great for the dry fluffy stuff, once the snow gets sloshy, this unit is underpowered. Happy with the warranty, reached out to manufacturer and they are shipping me a new unit. I will keep it as a back up for my new gas powered two stage thrower.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start for clearing snow off driveways
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recent 5 inch snow to clear a 100 foot driveway- a lot easier than shoveling! Being electric it’s easy to start
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Gas powered snowblower with this.
customer_reviews.text: I had a big gas powered snow blower that died and purchased this unit as a replacement. I purchased this unit based on the cost and the reviews. I purchase late in the snow season so did not think I would get to try it out unit next winter. This weekend we received 6 inches of wet snow. This unit worked very well for as wet as the snow is. Unit was easy to assemble. Unfold the handle and attach the arm that turns the shut. Blower get all the snow off. I did not have to go back over with a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: Fights. Throws snow. Makes sandwiches.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like some folks received defective units. That sucks...cuz mine rocks. It doesn't make sandwiches, after all. But guess what? This little sucker just fights. I cleared out about 8" of accumulated snow in my driveway in about 10 minutes, only having to do minimal coaxing for some icy spots. It's not going to throw the snow more than about eight feet...but it works like a total champ.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Glinatsis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it was a very good purchase, have not used it yet, just waiting for snow.
customer_reviews.author: Delia Marroquin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store and use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for 2 years without issue. Heavy or wet snow makes it a little harder to use but if it only a couple inches it is manageable. Easy to store and use. Cord is a little bit of a pain but you have to expect that. If this one ever dies I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Barkman

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy I got this machine
customer_reviews.text: I have used this snow thrower 10 times now, 8 times last winter alone. We had snows of 8 inches last winter in Fort Wayne (IN) and this guy handled every one. The cord is a minor hassle, but it always threw the snow. One time when the temp was around freezing, the snow started packing really badly. Then it struggled a little, but no complaints here. It always cleared my 80 foot drive. I am very happy I got this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Boys

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1 year later
customer_reviews.text: This product quick working 13 months after purchase. Still working with the warranty plan to attempt a replacement or repair.
customer_reviews.author: james webb

customer_reviews.title: Still in use after many years of winter service. No Trouble yet.
customer_reviews.text: Even with high snows, I take small bites and can still clear the snow. Well made and should last many more years.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: i hated that!
customer_reviews.text: Well it is very powerful and it does throw the snow! my only draw back is the cord but i guess i will have to figure out how to deal with that problem. (since i knew what i was ordering in the first place). I guess you just have to have a planned route so the cord does not bother you. That is the only draw back. oh yea no gas and oil to mix up......i hated that!!
customer_reviews.author: RHONDA GUNTHER

customer_reviews.title: No Blow Snow Joe
customer_reviews.text: Right now - it's going back! We got a few inches of snow yesterday (It's the Thanksgiving 2013 blizzard in NE Ohio) and my husband said it wouldn't move the wet snow and definitely didn't throw it 10 ft. like some others have said. Totally disappointed as I surprised him with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Girl

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: In December we had 9 inches of heavy wet snow.I did half the drive and then ordered the Snow Joe on Wednesday .It arrived on Friday and I did the rest of the drive about 60' x 8'. By this time it was even heaver and had a crust of ice on the top.The Snow Joe just ate it up.I was amazed.Plus I have a gravel drive.One thing I learned was that if you get an extension cord longer then 50 ft you need to get a 12 gauge cord.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t leave reviews but I owe it to them after using this machine. KC got dumped on today and this little machine cut through huge snow drifts no problem. I am absolutely amazed. It’s incredible and worth every penny! Well done. It’s rare to find a quality product that exceeds expectation these days. Man this thing did! Get one! I’ve already told all my family and friends!
customer_reviews.author: SDH816

customer_reviews.title: Great for little to no experience
customer_reviews.text: Just used my Snow Joe for the first time today in 12 inches of snow and I couldn't be any happier with it. I have very little experience with snow removal. I was a little nervous about using it, but in anticipation of the storm, I put it together last night. Assembly was light and very easy. Using the snowblower was very simple and it did an amazing job in the deep snow. It would have been very laborious work had I not had this helpful machine. So glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I've been able to use this in snow that is deeper than the housing is tall. For what it is, I'm very pleased. Just realize that it is not a gasoline powered blower. It will never perform like one. It is VERY loud. It howls. I live just outside Philadelphia. It snows hard sometimes, and sometimes not. Rather than have a lot of money invested in a gasoline powered device, I can put up with a little inconvenience. I don't have to have gasoline around. I don't have to maintain a gasoline engine. It's just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: T G CRABTREE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for low to moderate snow
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for the price. Does a great job throwing the snow a good 10+ feet. No way it does 10” deep snow. 4” is about the max before it bogs down but for what I need it’s perfect and the cost was cheap. Beats paying $1000 or more for a gas snow blower and no maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: This little snow thrower is perfect for me. I have a small driveway and sidewalk and it does the job.I even take it up on my back deck to clear the snow. I won't repeat all the great things about this unit that others have stated, but the no maintenance and that fact that I can just pick it up and bring it on my porch sold me. One year I shoveled (quite aggressively), I hurt my back . . . so never again! I use the Snow Joe and do a little shoveling and life is good.
customer_reviews.author: SDH

customer_reviews.title: Good Product @ the right price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for $118.00 on amazon. I have used it three times on 2-3 inches of snow and it has worked great. As long as your expectations are in line with the price you pay you will be happy. The Cord takes a little getting used to but really is not that big of a deal. It does not do very will in wet slushey snow but fresh powder it has no problem with. It throws the snow about 5-10 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: saved me this year!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little snow blower! I bought it two years ago, after our horrible "snowmageddon" winter. We haven't had enough since then to bother getting it out of the basement, but this year has been another story. This snow blower has handled snows of 6, 12 and 8 inches with ease. I would say 12 inches is about as much as it's capable of handling. Wet snow no problem, easy to use and put together. I would (and have) recommended this snow blower to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JTO

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my driveway
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works great for my needs. I have an average driveway and then a sidewalk in front of my house. The Snow Joe can take care of it very easily. I have had upto 8" of snow all over and then some 10" drifts and Snow Joe went right through them. Any higher and you might have to take a couple of passes at it but I'm sure Snow Joe can handle it. Yes the cord does take a little getting used to but for the price and the amount of time I'm saving this winter it is more then worth it. I will buy another one if this one ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Edited Visions

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last winter but never had a chance to use it. This year I've used it quite a few times. It works a lot better than I thought for an electric snow thrower. It's light and doesn't take up much space in my garage. Best thing is I don't have to worry about purchasing gas or wondering if I'll be able to start it. Plug in and go. Environmentally friendly, too! I use it on my sidewalk and driveway. It cleared some pretty high snow this year.
customer_reviews.author: CornwallGal

customer_reviews.title: Good little machine
customer_reviews.text: For it’s small size, does a great job. I had it dig into compacted snow from a snowplow and it did a much better job than what I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Woeste

customer_reviews.title: Easily clears snow up to almost 2 feet
customer_reviews.text: This is the little electric snow-blower that could and will. This thing saved my back when I lived in the Fargo/Moorhead area. Easily clears snow up to almost 2 feet, anything over that will take a few passes to clear. No complaints. -1 star for the bolts that attach then handle to the rest of the blower. Sheared one off when some muscle needed to be applied to clear some rotten snow/ice.
customer_reviews.author: Poovs

customer_reviews.title: It will throw it a good distance and has enough power to not clog
customer_reviews.text: A little light so it will ride up in the hard pack snow. you just cant blast it through the heavy stuff. It will throw it a good distance and has enough power to not clog. So far working out really well. I would say you shouldnt use the whole 18 in but you can definitely use the majority of that 18 in. really impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: william kunesh

customer_reviews.title: "You get what you pay for". With this little ...
customer_reviews.text: "You get what you pay for". With this little mighty-might, I believe I got more. We have been absolutely buried in the Northeast in 2015, and this little guy has handled it all. The true test is the snow berm that forms at the end of the driveway, and this machine passed with flying colors. If you don't want to pay $600 for a larger, gas thrower, yet want to move up to (I'd say) 8" of snow, this thrower will do the trick. The only downside in my opinion is that you have to mess with the extension cord; but that is true of any electric tool.At least you don't need fresh gas and a new plug every year!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPro

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Did just as good if not better then the engine driven blower
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe SJ620
customer_reviews.text: First time I got a snow blower, I would just shovel it. With a car accident 2008 and blood clot in 2011, I'm just 49 years old I need something to help and this Snow blower did it. The only thing I don't like is I have a gravel driveway and its hard to push it up so it wouldn't pickup stones. It would be great if you have pavement walkway and driveway. So thank you Snow Joe SJ620 for the great winter so far... I live in Central PA and snow, snow, ice storm, snow ....
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Hockenberry

customer_reviews.title: worked great for 1 winter
customer_reviews.text: worked great for 1 winter, and did what I needed it to do. I realized though that I live on a gravel road and the punishment it causes plastic pieces behind the blade. I realized that I needed a dual stage to not kill my Snow Joe. I gave to my daughter in Baltimore and she loves it. It does what she needs it to do in less snow on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: maddawgmurph

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and easy to use for a small, older woman.
customer_reviews.text: This snow thrower was used several times this past winter and did the job of clearing my driveway nicely. We had much deeper snows this year and if you take your time it will do the job of throwing the snow. Does an excellent job on the drier snow but can handle the wet heavy snow too. Didn't have to rely on my neighbors (whom are very nice, but have their own driveways and walks to clear). Easy to handle for a woman, if I was a little younger, would have gotten a larger one. Very nice machine for sure.
customer_reviews.author: TskTskHappy#1

customer_reviews.title: For me it works wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised how this snowblower worked. It will blow snow a foot deep with no problem if you take your time even at full width. The cord is a pain sometimes but just think it's easier to deal with than a shovel. For me it works wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: acey

customer_reviews.title: Great Snowblower
customer_reviews.text: Was greatly impressed by how well the machine works. Having a snowblower with a cord can be a hassle but I dont mind it for the price and quality of this machine. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: It took forever but it has finally snowed enough to use the Snow Joe to remove snow from our huge deck. Finally, in early March we were able to put it to use. It cut hours off clearing the deck alone. (I was hoping it would at least snow once and be able to use it before Spring came.) Unfortunately it hasn't stopped snowing since. The only reason it is receiving 4 stars is that we really haven't used it long enough to grant it 5 stars. It's not too noisy and cleans great.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for two separate snowfalls now. It arrived the day before the first - a light, fluffy 6" snow that blew everywhere. It easily moved through it. What would normally take me about 45m-1hr shoveling took me about 10. Second storm was composed of a heavy, slushy, and wet 11". Again, this bad boy ate it up and spit it out - even the heavy chunks at the end of the driveway that had been plowed into a concrete-like substance. My neighbor across the way has a behemoth gas job - he kept having to stop to clean packed snow out of the chute. Oh buddy, not me! Zipped through it! I'M OUT! (drops the microphone)
customer_reviews.author: william jack

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine and great customer care!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Snow Joe for the times my husband is away on business trips. I am afraid of the other humongous snow thrower in our garage. When, it arrived I had a minor issue with the chute turning properly. I called Snow Joe customer service. They were fantastic. They walked me through the steps by phone on the operation of the machine. And even offered to send me a new unit if I wanted. But, was not necessary. It now works perfect. It even goes through the pile the street plowers dump at end of the drive.
customer_reviews.author: kfriend

product_meta.title: Snow Joe SJ620 Electric Single Stage Snow Thrower | 18-Inch | 13.5 Amp Motor
product_meta.description:
It's Electric, Boogie Woogie, Woogie! Responding to the need for an easy-to-use machine that could tackle heavier snowfall on mid-sized driveways and walkways, Snow Joe® developed the Snow Joe® Ultra SJ620, a larger electric snow thrower that delivers the power of a gas machine with the convenience of an electric unit. Driven by a powerful 13.5-amp motor, the Snow Joe® Ultra moves up to 650 lbs of snow per minute. Its durable, 4-blade rotor, constructed of heavy-grade steel, cuts 18 inches wide by 10 inches deep with each pass, clearing up to 2450 square feet per hour! In addition to its hard-working plowing capacity, the Snow Joe® Ultra features an adjustable discharge chute that rotates a complete 180º to provide full control over the snow stream direction. The chute deflector can also be adjusted to control the height of the snow stream. Easy-glide pivot wheels make the Snow Joe® Ultra easy to turn and maneuver on each pass. The scraper blade at the base of the unit efficiently scrapes the snow clear to the ground without damaging your deck or pavement. Powered electrically, the Snow Joe® Ultra SJ620 is effortless to start and maintain. No gas, oil, or tune-ups are necessary. The unit is ETL-approved and carries a full two year warranty. For heavier snowfall on mid-sized driveways and walkways, the Snow Joe®Ultra SJ620 is your smart solution this winter.

AMAZON.COM
Built to handle big driveways and deep snowfalls, the Snow Joe Ultra SJ620 can move 650 pounds of snow per minute. It cuts a swath 18 inches wide and 10 inches deep, and a scraper blade efficiently clears snow right to the pavement--all without significant strain on your body. And because this snow thrower is powered by electricity instead of gas, it is incredibly easy to start and maintain.



Snow Joe Ultra SJ620
At a Glance: * Each pass cuts a path 18 inches wide and 10 inches deep
   
   
 * Powerful 13-1/2 amp motor can move 650 pounds of snow per minute
   
   
 * 180-degree adjustable chute controls snow stream direction
   
   
 * Chute deflector controls height of snow stream
   
   
 * Instant Start for quick, convenient start-ups
   
   
 * Electric engine doesn't require gas, oil changes, or tune-ups
   
   
 * Ergonomic grips for improved operator comfort


13-1/2 amp motor and easy-glide pivot wheels let you work quickly and efficiently. View larger.

Four heavy-grade steel rotors move up to 650 pounds of snow per minute. View larger.Handles Big Driveways and Heavy Snowfalls
Behind the Snow Joe Ultra SJ620's dependable performance is a powerful 13-1/2 amp motor, which allows it to move up to 650 pounds of snow per minute. Built to help you clear walkways, patios, and driveways quickly and without straining your back, the SJ620 utilizes a heavy-grade steel, four-blade rotor , and can throw snow up to 20 feet. You don't have to worry about moving the same snow twice, even when clearing the middle of your driveway.With each pass, the SJ620 cuts a path that's a full 18 inches wide and 10 inches deep, and the snow thrower's scraper is designed to clear all the way to the pavement. This translates to an impressive 2,450 square feet of potential snow removal per hour.

Smart Details Keep You in Control
With an adjustable discharge chute, which rotates a complete 180 degrees, and a chute deflector that can be adjusted to control the height of the snow stream produced by the thrower, you have complete control over where the snow you move ends up.

And the body of the SJ620 is easy to maneuver and control. Compact, easy-glide, pivot wheels make it easy to turn the thrower at the end of each pass, while its ergonomic grips make it easy and comfortable to direct. In addition to making handling easier, the thrower's compact shape also makes storing the unit more convenient in between winter storms.

Electric Engine is Easy to Start and Maintain
The SJ620's corded electric design means that you never have to worry about dead batteries, running out of gas, or making the right gas-oil mix. And its electric engine doesn't require the costly regular maintenance of a combustion engine.

In addition, with push-button Instant Start technology, you can trust that this snow thrower will be ready to work whenever you are--no frustrating, arm-wrenching pull starts required.

The dependable Snow Joe Ultra SJ620 is ETL inspected and approved, and it is backed by a full two-year warranty.

What's in the Box
Snow thrower.





Push-button technology and ergonomic handles provide comfortable, hassle-free use.
Lever rotates chute up to 180 degrees
for snow-stream control.
Adjustable chute can throw snow up to
20 feet for optimum clearing. Snow Joe® Ultra Electric Snow Throwers SJ620

SJ621

SJ622E

SJ623E

Performance Capacity/Minute (the power to cut through snow) Up to 650 pounds / 295 kg Up to 650 pounds / 295 kg Up to 720 pounds / 327 kg Up to 720 pounds / 327 kg Throw Distance (the power to put snow in its place) Up to 20 feet / 6 m Up to 20 feet / 6 m Up to 25 feet / 7.5 m Up to 25 feet / 7.5 m Clearing Width (fewer passes gets the job done faster) 18 inches 18 inches 18 inches 18 inches Snow Cut Depth -- 1 Pass 10 inches 10 inches 10 inches 10 inches Engine Amps / Motor 13.5 amp / Snow Joe® 13.5 amp / Snow Joe® 15 amp / Snow Joe® 15 amp / Snow Joe® User-Friendly Features Deflector N/A N/A N/A N/A Chute Control Manual 180° chute rotation Manual 180° chute rotation Manual 180° chute rotation Manual 180° chute rotation Rotor 4 steel blades 4 steel blades 4 steel blades 4 steel blades Ideal for Medium driveways and walkways Medium driveways and walkways Medium to large driveways and walkways Medium to large driveways and walkways Weight 31.5 pounds / 14.3 kg 33.3 pounds / 15.1 kg 31.8 pounds / 14.4 kg 34 pounds / 15.4kg Warranty 2 year full 2 year full 2 year full 2 year full Innovative Features Safety switch button prevents accidental starting Safety switch button prevents accidental starting Safety switch button prevents accidental starting Safety switch button prevents accidental starting Compact wheels for easy maneuverabilityCompact wheels for easy maneuverabilityCompact wheels for easy maneuverabilityCompact wheels for easy maneuverability 20 watt halogen lightClean out tool20 watt halogen light Clean out tool
feature_bullets: Ideal for quick snow pickups on mid-sized driveways and walkways.
No gas, oil or tune-ups make it effortless to start and maintain.
Powerful 13.5-amp motor moves up to 650 lbs of snow per minute.
4-blade steel auger cuts 18 in. wide by 10 in. deep with each pass.
180° adjustable directional chute throws snow up to 20 ft.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,067 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
